definitions.definition: a dry mass of very small fine pieces or grains

examples.text: lumps of chalk crushed to a fine white powder
a wide range of cleaning fluids and powders
The mustard is sold in powder form.
powder skiing *(= on fine dry snow)*
Before the photo dries, the image is dusted with a special powder.
The seeds are ground into a fine powder before use.

definitions.definition: a very fine, soft, dry substance that you can put on your face to make it look smooth and dry

examples.text: I only use lipstick and a little powder.
She quickly dabbed some powder on her cheeks.

definitions.definition: explosive powder used especially in bombs or fireworks
to remain ready for a possible emergency
to leave suddenly; to run away

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French poudre, from Latin pulvis, pulver- ‘dust’.
